source_note: State baseline derived from MassDEP Recycling and Waste Ban regulations; local programs may vary.

organics.guidance: Commercial food waste banned from disposal under 310 CMR 19.017; residential composting encouraged.
organics.bin: Green bin or compost drop-off site.
organics.notes: Boston, Cambridge, and others have curbside composting programs.

paper_cardboard.guidance: Recycle clean paper and cardboard; flatten boxes.
paper_cardboard.notes: Waxed or contaminated paper not accepted.

glass_containers.guidance: Recycle bottles and jars (rinsed, no lids).

metal_containers.guidance: Recycle aluminum and steel/tin cans (empty and clean).

plastics.guidance: Recycle plastic bottles, jugs, and tubs labeled #1–#7.
plastics.notes: Plastic bags and foam not accepted curbside.

beverage_containers_crv.guidance: Massachusetts has a 5¢ bottle deposit on eligible containers.
beverage_containers_crv.bin: Return to redemption center or retailer.
beverage_containers_crv.notes: Covers most glass, metal, and plastic beverage containers.

household_batteries.guidance: Recycle rechargeable and lead-acid batteries via HHW or Call2Recycle.
household_batteries.notes: Keep batteries out of trash or curbside bins.

e_waste.guidance: E-waste banned from disposal under MassDEP Waste Ban regulations.
e_waste.bin: Drop-off at e-waste collection or HHW site.

plastic_bags_and_film.guidance: Plastic bag bans in effect in most municipalities; film accepted at store drop-offs.
plastic_bags_and_film.bin: Return film to retail collection bins.
provenance: MassDEP and municipal plastic bag ordinances

bulky_items.guidance: Schedule bulky item pickup or drop off at transfer station.
provenance: Boston Public Works bulky item collection
